title: What’s the smartest that a giant (like 30-ish ft tall) species could be? - Quora

response.answer_text: Their leg bones would have to be the size of bridge pillions to support such a tall creature. Osteologists declare that the modern elephant is the largest land animal possible - based on calculations of limits on weight bearing bones. There are skeletal remains of dinosaurs much, MUCH larger than elephants, but I haven’t found a credible explanation for it yet, though there was one Quora post claiming that in those days the gravity of Earth was lower, thus they could grow so much taller.

I have made up a species that's at least sixty feet tall and superintelligent during the day. It's an intelligent tree. While super intelligent trees may not be able to evolve due to energy constraints, I don't see how being big constrains intelligence. It does constrain body plan, however
